description: From Middle English coverchef et al., from Old French couvrechief, from couvrir (“to cover”) + chief (“head”).

entries.meaning: (dated) A piece of cloth used to cover the head; a bandana.

verbs.description: kerchief (third-person singular simple present kerchiefs, present participle kerchiefing, simple past and past participle kerchiefed)

entries.meaning: (dated, transitive) To cover with a kerchief.
